messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

llc: /tmp/llvm-gh-138944/build/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp:7789: llvm::SDValue llvm::SelectionDAG::getNode(unsigned int, const llvm::SDLoc&, llvm::EVT, llvm::SDValue, llvm::SDValue, llvm::SDValue, llvm::SDNodeFlags): Assertion `N1.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE && N2.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE && N3.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE && "Operand is DELETED_NODE!"' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/llc -o - /testcases/llvm-gh-138944/input/poc.ll
1.	Running pass 'Function Pass Manager' on module '/testcases/llvm-gh-138944/input/poc.ll'.
2.	Running pass 'X86 DAG->DAG Instruction Selection' on function '@_Z3foo4fVec'

    - main llvm/tools/llc/llc.cpp:400:35

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

messages.message:
Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp
+++ b/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp
@@ -7788,10 +7788,19 @@ SDValue SelectionDAG::getNode(unsigned Opcode, const SDLoc &DL, EVT VT,
                                SDValue N1, SDValue N2, SDValue N3,
                                const SDNodeFlags Flags) {
-  assert(N1.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE &&
-         N2.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE &&
-         N3.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE &&
-         "Operand is DELETED_NODE!");
+  if (N1.getOpcode() == ISD::DELETED_NODE ||
+      N2.getOpcode() == ISD::DELETED_NODE ||
+      N3.getOpcode() == ISD::DELETED_NODE) {
+#ifndef NDEBUG
+    assert(false && "Operand is DELETED_NODE!");
+#endif
+    return SDValue();
+  }
   // Perform various simplifications.
   switch (Opcode) {
   case ISD::FMA:
'}`
responded: The root cause of the crash is that the code asserts that none of the operands (N1, N2, N3) are `ISD::DELETED_NODE` in the 3-operand `getNode` overload, but this is only checked in an `assert` (i.e., only in debug builds). In release builds, if any operand is a deleted node, this will lead to undefined behavior or a crash.

The 4-operand version (with `ArrayRef<SDValue> Ops`) does a similar check, but only in debug builds (`#ifndef NDEBUG`). The sanitizer report shows a crash in release mode, so we need to add a runtime check in the 3-operand overload to handle this gracefully.

**Patch plan:**
- In `SelectionDAG::getNode(unsigned Opcode, const SDLoc &DL, EVT VT, SDValue N1, SDValue N2, SDValue N3, const SDNodeFlags Flags)`, before the assert, add a runtime check: if any operand is a deleted node, return an empty `SDValue()` (or handle as appropriate).
- This prevents the crash in release builds and matches the defensive programming style.

Let's generate the patch.

message.name: validate
message.result:
Sorry, the patch is incorrect. Here is the applied patch, which may have been revised and differ from the original:
diff --git a/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp b/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp
index bbf1b0fd590e..4135f6c1426c 100644
--- a/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp
+++ b/llvm/lib/CodeGen/SelectionDAG/SelectionDAG.cpp
@@ -7786,10 +7786,14 @@ SDValue SelectionDAG::getNode(unsigned Opcode, const SDLoc &DL, EVT VT,
 SDValue SelectionDAG::getNode(unsigned Opcode, const SDLoc &DL, EVT VT,
                               SDValue N1, SDValue N2, SDValue N3,
                               const SDNodeFlags Flags) {
-  assert(N1.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE &&
-         N2.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE &&
-         N3.getOpcode() != ISD::DELETED_NODE &&
-         "Operand is DELETED_NODE!");
+  if (N1.getOpcode() == ISD::DELETED_NODE ||
+      N2.getOpcode() == ISD::DELETED_NODE ||
+      N3.getOpcode() == ISD::DELETED_NODE) {
+#ifndef NDEBUG
+    assert(false && "Operand is DELETED_NODE!");
+#endif
+    return SDValue();
+  }
   // Perform various simplifications.
   switch (Opcode) {
   case ISD::FMA:

Here is the validation report:
